In Zechariah we read: [Zechariah 3:1-10, quoted]. 
     The garments of the church of Christ, soiled with sin, are removed, and Christ places upon His faithful, obedient children their coronation robes. "God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes, and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away. . . . There shall be no night there" [Revelation 21:4, 25].
